events.message: The customer reported a car collision that occurred on April 28th involving their vehicle and a streetlight.
The claim was reviewed and categorised as an auto accident claim based on the customer's description and evidence.
An insurance agent was assigned to the case to guide the customer through the claim process efficiently.
The customer was sent an official acknowledgment of the claim along with information on the next steps.
The agent requested the customer to submit photographs of the damaged vehicle and a police report from the accident.
The customer provided all requested documents including photos and an official police report promptly on May 4th.
The claims investigation team began reviewing the submitted evidence and evaluating the incident circumstances.
The investigation was completed successfully, confirming the fault and extent of damage to the insured vehicle.
A settlement offer was prepared and proposed to the customer for damage repairs and related costs.
The customer responded positively to the settlement terms and expressed satisfaction with the claim handling.
Based on the agreement, the claim was approved, authorizing the payment to proceed without further delay.
Insurance payment was issued to the customerâ€™s bank account covering the vehicle repair costs approved.
The claim file was officially closed confirming that all procedures and payments were completed successfully.
The case documents and records were archived in the system for future reference and audit purposes.
